definitions.definition: The current moment or period of time.
The present tense.
Relating to now, for the time being; current.
definitions.example: The barbaric practice continues to the present day.

definitions.definition: Located in the immediate vicinity.
definitions.example: Is there a doctor present?  Several people were present when the event took place.

definitions.definition: Having an immediate effect (of a medicine, poison etc.); fast-acting.
Not delayed; immediate; instant.
Ready; quick in emergency.
Favorably attentive; propitious.
Relating to something a person is referring to in the very context, with a deictic use similar to the demonstrative adjective this.
definitions.example: in the present study,  the present article,  the present results.

definitions.definition: Attentive; alert; focused.
definitions.example: Sorry, I was distracted just now, I'll try to be more present from now on.

definitions.definition: A gift, especially one given for birthdays, Christmas, anniversaries, graduations, weddings, or any other special occasions.
The position of a soldier in presenting arms.
To bring (someone) into the presence of (a person); to introduce formally.
definitions.example: to present an envoy to the king

definitions.definition: To nominate (a member of the clergy) for an ecclesiastical benefice; to offer to the bishop or ordinary as a candidate for institution.
To offer (a problem, complaint) to a court or other authority for consideration.
To charge (a person) with a crime or accusation; to bring before court.
To come forward, appear in a particular place or before a particular person, especially formally.
To put (something) forward in order for it to be seen; to show, exhibit.
To make clear to one's mind or intelligence; to put forward for consideration.
To put on, stage (a play etc.).
definitions.example: The theater is proud to present the Fearless Fliers.

definitions.definition: To point (a firearm) at something, to hold (a weapon) in a position ready to fire.
To offer oneself for mental consideration; to occur to the mind.
definitions.example: Well, one idea does present itself.

definitions.definition: To come to the attention of medical staff, especially with a specific symptom.
To appear (in a specific way) for delivery (of a fetus); to appear first at the mouth of the uterus during childbirth.
(with "as") To appear or represent oneself (as having a certain gender).
To act as presenter on (a radio, television programme etc.).
To give a gift or presentation to (someone).
definitions.example: She was presented with an honorary degree for her services to entertainment.

definitions.definition: To give (a gift or presentation) to someone; to bestow.
To deliver (something abstract) as though as a gift; to offer.
definitions.example: I presented my compliments to Lady Featherstoneshaw.

definitions.definition: To hand over (a bill etc.) to be paid.
To display one's female genitalia in a way that signals to others that one is ready for copulation. Also referred to as lordosis behaviour.
